title:
Lower Bounds for Admissible Values of the Travelling Wave Speed in
  Asymmetrically Supported Beam
authors: Hana Form\'ankov\'a Lev\'a, Gabriela Holubov\'a, Petr Ne\v{c}esal
abstract:
We study the admissible values of the wave speed $c$ for which the beam
equation with jumping nonlinearity possesses a travelling wave solution. In
contrast to previously studied problems modelling suspension bridges, the
presence of the term with negative part of the solution in the equation results
in restrictions of $c$. In this paper, we provide the maximal wave speed range
for which the existence of the travelling wave solution can be proved using the
Mountain Pass Theorem. We also introduce its close connection with related
Dirichlet problems and their Fu\v{c}\'{i}k spectra. Moreover, we present
several analytical approximations of the main existence result with assumptions
that are easy to verify. Finally, we formulate a conjecture that the infimum of
the admissible wave speed range can be described by the Fu\v{c}\'{i}k spectrum
of a simple periodic problem.
